summary: An FBI incident summary from October 2021, closed as 'Information Only', detailing accusations of violent rape and human trafficking made by two women against James 'Jes' Edwards Staley, CEO of Barclays Bank. The information was provided by an attorney for the Virgin Islands Attorney General investigating the Jeffrey Epstein estate, who also indicated Epstein's attorney and accountant were aware of and helped cover up crimes.

persons.name: James 'Jes' Edwards Staley
persons.role: CEO of Barclays Bank, Subject of accusations
persons.context: Accused by two women of violent rape; the accusations were relayed to the FBI by an attorney investigating the Epstein estate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier, subject of estate investigation
persons.context: Mentioned as the deceased individual whose estate is under civil investigation by the Virgin Islands Attorney General; his attorney and accountant were allegedly aware of and helped cover up crimes.

connections.description: Staley is accused of crimes (violent rape) that were reportedly known to and covered up by Epstein's attorney and accountant, implying a potential connection through the alleged criminal activities and cover-up.

events.title: Initial FBI Conference on Allegations
events.description: A detective conferred with an FBI SSA regarding intelligence and its origin related to accusations against Jes Staley.

events.title: FBI Conference with AUSA
events.description: A detective conferred with an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) regarding the information provided about the accusations.

events.title: Incident Closed as Information Only
events.description: The FBI incident report regarding accusations against Jes Staley was closed, with a disposition of 'Information Only'.

keyFacts: Two women accused James 'Jes' Edwards Staley, CEO of Barclays Bank, of violent rape; one woman believed she had previously reported this to the FBI.
An attorney for the Virgin Islands Attorney General, investigating the Jeffrey Epstein estate in a civil matter, provided this information to the FBI to ensure they were aware of the accusations.
The attorney's investigation indicated that Epstein's attorney and accountant were aware of criminal activities and helped perpetuate them by covering them up.
The FBI incident was closed on October 18, 2021, with a status of 'Closed' and a disposition of 'Information Only'.
Detectives and agents in New York were noted as being aware of complaints associated with the listed individuals (presumably including Staley).
